mlr3mbspls 0.2.11
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Quick Start with mlr3mbspls

Extract up to ncomp orthogonal latent components from multiple data blocks

Source: R/PipeOpMBsPLS.R
PipeOpMBsPLS.Rd

PipeOpMBsPLS fits sequential MB-sPLS models and appends one latent variable (LV) per block and component to the task's backend. After each component the corresponding rank-1 structure is removed (block-wise score deflation in the sense of Westerhuis et al., 2001), ensuring that successive LVs are orthogonal within every block.

The training objective is controlled by performance_metric:

  • "mac": mean absolute correlation (average of \(|r|\) across all block-score pairs) per component;

  • "frobenius": Frobenius norm of the block-score correlation matrix \(\sqrt{\sum r^2}\).

We refer to this scalar as the latent correlation.

During prediction, the same criterion (MAC/Frobenius) and explained variances are computed on test data and, if log_env is provided, a compact payload is written to log_env$last. Optionally, prediction-side validation tests can be requested (permutation or bootstrap; see Parameters).

The operator is a pure transformer: it performs no internal resampling, tuning or preprocessing. Hyper-parameters such as the L1 sparsity levels \(c_\mathrm{block}\) are tuned externally (e.g., with mlr3tuning).

Value

A PipeOpMBsPLS that outputs either only LVk_<block> columns (default) or the original features plus appended LV columns (if append=TRUE).

Details

Multi-Block Sparse Partial Least Squares (MB-sPLS) Transformer

State (after training)

blocks

Named list mapping block names to feature column IDs.

weights

List of length ncomp; block-specific weight vectors \(w_b^{(k)}\).

loadings

List of block loadings \(p_b^{(k)}\) used for deflation.

ncomp

Number of components retained.

obj_vec

Objective values (MAC/Frobenius) per component (training).

latent_cor_train

Objective value of the last retained component (training).

ev_block

Training explained variance per block (rows = components, cols = blocks).

ev_comp

Training explained variance per component (summed across blocks).

p_values

Permutation p-values per component if enabled during training.

performance_metric

"mac" or "frobenius".

c_matrix

If provided/derived, the block-by-component sparsity matrix.

T_mat

Training score matrix (per-component deflation applied); columns ordered LV1_<block1>, ..., LV1_<blockB>, LV2_<block1>, ....

weights_stable

Optional stability-filtered weights (from the bootstrap PipeOp).

Prediction-side logging (log_env$last)

A list containing:

  • mac_comp: numeric vector (length ncomp) with test MAC/Frobenius per component,

  • ev_block: matrix (ncomp x n_blocks) with test per-block explained variances,

  • ev_comp: numeric vector (ncomp) with test per-component EV (summed across blocks),

  • T_mat: test scores (n_test x (ncomp * n_blocks)) with the same column order as training,

  • blocks: character vector with block names,

  • perf_metric: objective used ("mac" or "frobenius"),

  • time: POSIXct timestamp,

  • val_test_p: (if val_test = "permutation" or "bootstrap") per-component p-values,

  • val_test_stat: (if available) observed test statistic per component,

  • val_bootstrap: (if val_test = "bootstrap") data.table with observed statistic, bootstrap mean/SE, p-value, and CI per component.

Parameters

Hyperparameters are defined in the object's param_set and can be set via param_vals. Block membership (blocks) is a constructor argument and stored in the object state.

Construction

PipeOpMBsPLS$new(id = "mbspls", blocks, param_vals = list())

Methods

  • $new(id, blocks, param_vals) : Initialize the PipeOpMBsPLS.

Fields

  • blocks : Named list mapping block names to character vectors of feature names. Set during initialization.

See also

Other PipeOps: PipeOpSiteCorrection, PipeOpTargetLabelFilter

Initialize the PipeOpMBsPLS.

Usage

PipeOpMBsPLS$new(id = "mbspls", blocks, param_vals = list())

Arguments

id

character(1). Identifier of the resulting object.

blocks

named list. Map of block names to feature column names.

param_vals

named list. List of hyperparameter settings.

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

PipeOpMBsPLS$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.
